title: See the Princess Diana photo that Harry and Meghan just received as a gift
text:
From Harper's BAZAAR

The Duke and Duchess of Sussex are currently midway on their royal tour of Africa and South Africa with their son Archie, their first as a family of three.

The couple received a very special gift during their tour, from the Desmond & Leah Tutu Legacy Foundation.

The royals were given a photograph of Princess Diana meeting with Nelson Mandela in 1997.

Photo credit: Benny Gool/ Iconic Images More

It shows Diana shaking hands with the former president of South Africa. In the picture, she's wearing a polka-dot button-up tea dress with dainty pearling earrings to match.



Photo credit: Max Mumby/Indigo - Getty Images More

The duchess recently paid tribute to her husband Prince Harry's late mother, by wearing her earrings and and a bracelet whilst launching her workwear collection with Smart Works.

Photo credit: Dave Benett - Getty Images More

She wore a pair of butterfly earrings that the late princess wore during a royal tour of British Columbia in 1986. She also wore a gold bangle, which features two deep blue stones, that was seen on Diana on multiple occasions.

It's not just the duchess paying respects to Diana, as Prince Harry followed in her footsteps as he walked through a minefield in Angola. The late Prince of Wales originally visited a field scattered with lethal explosives in 1997 and the pictures instantly went viral.
